result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Allen Staples was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher Allen Staples is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher Allen Staples was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Concurrent to Burnett County Case #14CF50.
-Court dismisses Counts 1 and 2.
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: 14CF50

superMiscConds.notes: $90.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 3 Case #14CF54.

$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 3 Case #14CF54.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 3 Case #14CF54.

-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and the Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with A.L., A.K., R.H. or K.S.

CO: RMW, REP: Deiss, CLERK: LiddleADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Kate Mary Murtaugh   DF:  Christopher Allen Staples appeared from jail. Case called at 8:37 a.m. ADA Nieskes gives recommendations. Does not request a PSI. Atty Murtaugh states there was a PSI completed on the Burnett Co. Cases. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 3 in 14CF54. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 3 Burglary in 14CF54. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct's 1 & 2 in 14CF54. Sentencing arguments. Victim Ms. Straining makes statement. DE makes statement. 20 days to file appeal. QUASH WARRANT. 

Crt orders:

Total Confinement of 7 years:
  - Bifurcated sentence of I/C 3 years, E/S 4 years. Concurrent to Burnett Co. Case 14CF50. Sentence credit 135 days.
-   DNA Sample
-   Court Costs and DNA Surcharge.
-   Eligible for the substance abuse program and ERP
-   Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections
-   Restitution in the amount of $90.00 payable to Amanda Kinney
-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  A.L., A.K., R.H., and K.S. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.
Ad Prosequendum. km

Pre-trial conference on April 16, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 16, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

*AMENDED*

DE is to go directly from ST. Croix County to the ARC program or make himself available to Burnett County for transport.  If DE does not complete the program or is released he is to report to St. Croix County or Burnett County.  

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Ronnie H., Kristina S., Allen B. and Amanda K.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
